Title: The binomial coefficient $n\choose m$ is divisible by $n/\gcd(n,m)$
Content: Prove that for every $n\geq m \geq1$ natural numbers, the following number is an integer: $${\gcd(n,m)\over n}\cdot{n\choose m}$$ Where $\gcd$ is the greatest common divisor. I tried to make it simpler by cancelling the $n$ from the left side, and making it $(n-1)!$ on the right: $\gcd(n, m) \cdot \frac{(n-1)!}{m!(n-m)!}$, but can't really go further. This was problem B-2 on the 2000 Putnam exam .
